parameters.info: Custom parset file (note: all paths in the parset must be relative to the mount points inside the container). Advance usage only.
parameters.name: Parset

parameters.info: Name(s) of database to image
parameters.name: Data-MS

parameters.info: ColName to image
parameters.name: Data-ColName

parameters.info: Chunk data into time bins of x hours to conserve memory
parameters.name: Data-ChunkHours

parameters.info: Sort the data by baseline-time order internally. Can improve processing speed
parameters.name: Data-Sort

parameters.info: MS column to write predict to. Can be left empty to disable
parameters.name: Predict-ColName

parameters.info: Use this field if you want to predict (in/out)side a square region. Syntax is (MaskOutSide,NpixInside). For example setting (0,1000) will predict the outer (1000x1000) square only
parameters.name: Predict-MaskSquare

parameters.info: In --Image-Mode=Predict, will predict data from this image, rather than --Data-InitDicoModel
parameters.name: Predict-FromImage

parameters.info: Resume deconvolution from given DicoModel
parameters.name: Predict-InitDicoModel

parameters.info: Allow overwriting of predict column
parameters.name: Predict-Overwrite

parameters.info: Default FIELD_ID to read
parameters.name: Selection-Field

parameters.info: Default DATA_DESC_ID to read
parameters.name: Selection-DDID

parameters.info: Additional TaQL selection string
parameters.name: Selection-TaQL

parameters.info: First channel
parameters.name: Selection-ChanStart

parameters.info: Last channel+1, -1 means up and including last channel
parameters.name: Selection-ChanEnd

parameters.info: List of antennas to be flagged, e.g. 'RS,CS017LBA'
parameters.name: Selection-FlagAnts

parameters.info: Select baseline range km_min,km_max
parameters.name: Selection-UVRangeKm

parameters.info: Select time range, in hours, since start of MS. Format H0,H1
parameters.name: Selection-TimeRange

parameters.info: Select antennas by specifying a maximum distance to core
parameters.name: Selection-DistMaxToCore

parameters.info: Output mode
parameters.name: Output-Mode

parameters.info: Clobber output
parameters.name: Output-Clobber

parameters.info: Image name prefix
parameters.name: Output-Name

parameters.info: Output name for restoring beam
parameters.name: Output-RestoringBeam

parameters.info: Additionally output specified set of images. See Output-Images for arguments
parameters.name: Output-Also

parameters.info: Specify cubes to output. Any combination of MmRrIi are acceptable. See Output-Images for explanation on types
parameters.name: Output-Cubes

parameters.info: Specify images to output. Combination of letter codes indicating what images to save. Uppercase for intrinsic flux scale [D]irty, [M]odel, [C]onvolved model, [R]esiduals, restored [I]mage; Lowercase for apparent flux scale  [d]irty, [m]odel, [c]onvolved model, [r]esiduals, restored [i]mage; Other images: [P]SF, [N]orm, [n]orm facets, [S] flux scale, [A]lpha (spectral index), [X] mixed-scale (intrinsic model, apparent residuals, i.e. Cyrils original output), [o] intermediate mOdels (Model_i), [e] intermediate rEsiduals (Residual_i), [k] intermediate masK image, [z] intermediate auto mask-related noiZe image, [g] intermediate dirty images (only if [Debugging] SaveIntermediateDirtyImages is enabled). Use 'all' to save all. (default: DdPAMRIikz)
parameters.name: Output-Images

parameters.info: Number of pixels in output Image
parameters.name: Image-NPix

parameters.info: Cell size of pixels in output image (in arcseconds)
parameters.name: Image-Cell

parameters.info: Manually specify image phase centre in format RA,DEC
parameters.name: Image-PhaseCenterRADEC

parameters.info: Manually specify sidelobe search window when fitting the restoring beam. Specify number of pixels
parameters.name: Image-SidelobeSearchWindow

parameters.info: Number of facets to use
parameters.name: Facets-NFacets

parameters.info: Override facet directions with catalogue
parameters.name: Facets-CatNodes

parameters.info: Maximum facet size (deg). Larger facets will be broken up
parameters.name: Facets-DiamMax

parameters.info: Minimum facet size (deg). Smaller facets will be merged
parameters.name: Facets-DiamMin

parameters.info: For cleaning, oversize PSF relative to the size of the facet
parameters.name: Facets-PSFOversize

parameters.info: Number of PSFs to create. 0: one per facet, 1: one PSF for entire field
parameters.name: Facets-PSFFacets

parameters.info: Facet padding factor. Value should be >>> 1.0 to account for anti-aliasing filter rolloff.
parameters.name: Facets-Padding

parameters.info: Read data weights from specified column. Use WEIGHT_SPECTRUM or WEIGHT, more rarely IMAGING_WEIGHT.
parameters.name: Weight-ColName

parameters.info: UV weighting mode
parameters.name: Weight-Mode

parameters.info: If True, MFS uniform/Briggs weighting is used (all channels binned onto one uv grid). If 0, binning is per-band.
parameters.name: Weight-MFS

parameters.info: Briggs robustness parameter, from -2 (more uniform) to 2 (more natural)
parameters.name: Weight-Robust

parameters.info: Super/subuniform weighting: FoV for weighting purposes is taken as X*Image_Size
parameters.name: Weight-SuperUniform

parameters.info: Gridding polarization mode (non-stokes I is only supported in Imager-Mode=Dirty)
parameters.name: RIME-PolMode

parameters.info: FFTW engine
parameters.name: RIME-FFTMachine

parameters.info: Forward predict engine
parameters.name: RIME-ForwardMode

parameters.info: Backward inversion engine
parameters.name: RIME-BackwardMode

parameters.info: Decorrelation mode (undocumented ???)
parameters.name: RIME-DecorrMode

parameters.info: Decorrelation location
parameters.name: RIME-DecorrLocation

parameters.info: Convolution filter oversampling factor
parameters.name: CF-OverS

parameters.info: AA convolution filter support
parameters.name: CF-Support

parameters.info: Number of w-planes. Should be selected such that the projection error at the edge of the facet is << 1 radian per w plane
parameters.name: CF-Nw

parameters.info: Overwrite maximum w (in metres) of the interferometer sampling. This controlls the support needed for the w kernels and can bring down computational costs if more error is tolerated on the longest baselines
parameters.name: CF-wmax

parameters.info: Maximum tolerated BDA decorrelation response factor for gridding
parameters.name: Comp-GridDecorr

parameters.info: Maximum tolerated BDA decorrelation response factor for degridding
parameters.name: Comp-DegridDecorr

parameters.info: FoV over which gridding decorrelation factor is computed
parameters.name: Comp-GridFoV

parameters.info: Maximum tolerated BDA decorrelation response factor for degridding
parameters.name: Comp-GridDecorr

parameters.info: FoV over which degridding decorrelation factor is computed
parameters.name: Comp-DegridFoV

parameters.info: Apply sparsification compression to initial major cycles. Sparsification refers to throwing away random visibilities. Supply a list of factors: e.g. 100,30,10 would mean only 1/100 of the data is used for the first major cycle, 1/30 for the second, 1/10 for the third, and full data for the fourth cycle onwards. This can substantially accelerate deconvolution of deep observations, since, in these regimes, very little sensitivity is required for model construction in the initial cycles.
parameters.name: Comp-Sparsification

parameters.info: Number of processes / threads to use in parallel mode. 0 - all available. 1 - disable parallelism
parameters.name: Parallel-NCPU

parameters.info: Sets affinity of the subprocesses / threads.  -1/1/2 determines stepping used in selecting cores. Alternatively specifies a list of length NCPU. Alternatively 'disable' to disable affinity settings Alternatively 'enable_ht' uses stepping of 1 (equivalent to Parallel.Affinity=1), will use all vthreads - the obvious exception is if HT is disabled at BIOS level. Alternatively 'disable_ht' autodetects the NUMA layout of the chip for Debian-based systems and don't use both vthreads per core. Use 1 if unsure.
parameters.name: Parallel-Affinity

parameters.info: Pins parent process to specified core. This should be set to a vcore that is not used by forked processes, this option is ignored when using option 'disable' or 'disable_ht' for Parallel-Affinity.
parameters.name: Parallel-Affinity

parameters.info: Reset all caches (including PSF and dirty image)
parameters.name: Cache-Reset

parameters.info: Reset cached smooth beam
parameters.name: Cache-SmoothBeam

parameters.info: Cache PSF data
parameters.name: Cache-PSF

parameters.info: Cache dirty image data
parameters.name: Cache-Dirty

parameters.info: Cache visibility data and flags at runtime
parameters.name: Cache-VisData

parameters.info: Cache visibility data and flags at runtime
parameters.name: Cache-VisData

parameters.info: Cache last residual data (at end of last minor cycle)
parameters.name: Cache-LastResidual

parameters.info: Directory to store caches in. Default is to keep cache next to the MS, but this can cause performance issues with e.g. NFS volumes. If you have fast local storage, point to it.
parameters.name: Cache-Dir

parameters.info: Directory in which to store the FFTW wisdom files
parameters.name: Cache-DirWisdomFFTW

parameters.info: Reset wisdom file
parameters.name: Cache-ResetWisdom

parameters.info: Beam model to use.
parameters.name: Beam-Model

parameters.info: LOFAR beam mode.
parameters.name: Beam-LOFARBeamMode

parameters.info: N Number of channels over which same beam value is used. 0 means use every channel.
parameters.name: Beam-NBand

parameters.info: Normalize beam so that its amplitude at the centre is 1.
parameters.name: Beam-CenterNorm

parameters.info: BEAM_SMOOTH Compute the interpolated smooth beam
parameters.name: Beam-Smooth

parameters.info: BEAM_SMOOTHNPIX Number of pixels the beam is evaluated and smoothed
parameters.name: Beam-SmoothNPix

parameters.info: PATTERN Beam FITS file pattern. A beam pattern consists of eight FITS files, i.e. a real and imaginary part for each of the four Jones terms. The following substitutions are performed to form up the eight filenames: $(corr) or $(xy) is replaced by the Jones element label (e.g. "xx" or "rr"), $(reim) is replaced by "re" or "im", $(realimag) is replaced by "real" or "imag". Uppercase variables are replaced by uppercase values, e.g. $(REIM) by "RE" or "IM". Correlation labels (XY or RL) are determined by reading the MS, but may be overridden by the FITSFeed option.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSFile

parameters.info: If set, overrides correlation labels given by the MS.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSFeed

parameters.info: If set, overrides correlation labels given by the MS.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSFeed

parameters.info: MIN change in minutes on which the beam is re-evaluated
parameters.name: Beam-DtBeamMin

parameters.info: DEG increment in PA in degrees at which the beam is to be re-evaluated (on top of DtBeamMin)
parameters.name: Beam-FITSParAngleIncDeg

parameters.info: AXIS L axis of FITS file. Minus sign indicates reverse coordinate convention.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSLAxis

parameters.info: AXIS M axis of FITS file. Minus sign indicates reverse coordinate convention.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSMAxis

parameters.info: LEVEL set to >0 to have verbose output from FITS interpolator classes.
parameters.name: Beam-FITSVerbosity

parameters.info: MHz Gridding cube frequency step. If 0, --Freq-NBand is used instead.
parameters.name: Freq-BandMHz

parameters.info: MHz Degridding cube frequency step. If 0, --Freq- NDegridBand is used instead.
parameters.name: Freq-DegridBandMHz

parameters.info: N Number of image bands for gridding.
parameters.name: Freq-NBand

parameters.info: N Number of image bands for degridding. 0 means degrid each channel.
parameters.name: Freq-NDegridBand

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_DDSOLS (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-DDSols

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_GLOBALNORM (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-GlobalNorm

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_JONESNORMLIST (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-JonesNormList

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_DDMODEGRID (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-DDModeGrid

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_DDMODEDEGRID (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-DDModeDeGrid

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_SCALEAMPGRID (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-ScaleAmpGrid

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_SCALEAMPDEGRID (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-ScaleAmpDeGrid

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_CALIBERR (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-CalibErr

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_GAMMA (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-gamma

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_RESTORESUB (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-RestoreSub

parameters.info: DDESOLUTIONS_REWEIGHTSNR (???)
parameters.name: DDESolutions-ReWeightSNR

parameters.info: Deconvolution algorithm.
parameters.name: Deconv-Mode

parameters.info: N Max number of major cycles.
parameters.name: Deconv-MaxMajorIter

parameters.info: N Max number of (overall) minor cycle iterations (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-MaxMinorIter

parameters.info: Allow negative components (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-AllowNegative

parameters.info: GAIN Loop gain (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-Gain

parameters.info: Jy Absolute flux threshold at which deconvolution is stopped (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-FluxThreshold

parameters.info: X Cycle factor: used to set a minor cycle stopping threshold based on PSF sidelobe level (HMP, Hogbom). Use 0 to disable, otherwise 2.5 is a reasonable value, but may lead to very shallow minor cycle.
parameters.name: Deconv-CycleFactor

parameters.info: X Set minor cycle stopping threshold to X*{residual RMS} (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-RMSFactor

parameters.info: X Set minor cycle stopping threshold to X*{peak residual} (HMP, Hogbom).
parameters.name: Deconv-PeakFactor

parameters.info: N How many samples to draw for RMS computation. Use 0 to use all pixels (most precise).
parameters.name: Deconv-NumRMSSamples

parameters.info: SF when --Comp-Sparsification is on, use approximate (i.e. central facet) PSF for cleaning while operating above the given sparsification factor (SF). This speeds up HMP reinitialization in major cycles. A value of 1-10 is sensible. Set to 0 to always use precise per-facet PSF.
parameters.name: Deconv-ApproximatePSF

parameters.info: BOX determines the size of the PSF subtraction box used in CLEAN-style deconvolution (if appropriate). Use "auto" (or "sidelobe") for a Clark-CLEAN-style box taken out to a certain sidelobe (faster). Use "full" to subtract the full PSF, Hogbom-style (more accurate, can also combine with --Image-PSFOversize for maximum accuracy). Use an integer number to set an explicit box radius, in pixels. (HMP)
parameters.name: Deconv-PSFBox

parameters.info: FILENAME External clean mask image (FITS format)
parameters.name: Mask-External

parameters.info: MASK_AUTO Use automatic masking
parameters.name: Mask-Auto

parameters.info: set Threshold (in sigma) for automatic masking
parameters.name: Mask-SigTh

parameters.info: If Auto enabled, does the cut of SigTh either on the ModelConv or the Restored
parameters.name: Mask-FluxImageType

parameters.info: MIN,MAX,N String list of alphas to fit. e.g [-1.0, 1.0, 11]
parameters.name: HMP-Alpha

parameters.info: LIST String list of scales to use e.g [0]
parameters.name: HMP-Scales

parameters.info: HMP_RATIOS (???)
parameters.name: HMP-Ratios

parameters.info: N Number of PA steps to use.
parameters.name: HMP-NTheta

parameters.info: Solver mode: pseudoinverse, or non-negative least squares.
parameters.name: HMP-SolverMode

parameters.info: Allow the maximum residual to increase within the minor cycle
parameters.name: HMP-AllowResidIncrease

parameters.info: Weighting taper size for HMP fit. If 0, determined automatically.
parameters.name: HMP-Taper

parameters.info: Basis function support size. If 0, determined automatically.
parameters.name: HMP-Support

parameters.info: HMP_KAPPA Regularization parameter. If stddev of per-alpha solutions exceeds the maximum solution amplitude divided by Kappa, forces a fully-regularized solution. Use 0 for no such regularization.
parameters.name: HMP-Kappa

parameters.info: HOGBOM_POLYFITORDER polynomial order for frequency fitting
parameters.name: Hogbom-PolyFitOrder

parameters.info: URL for the TensorflowServer, e.g. grpc://tensorflow.server.com:8888/
parameters.name: Montblanc-TensorflowServerTarget

parameters.info: Enable parallel mode in SSD clean
parameters.name: SSDClean-Parallel

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_ISLANDDECONVMODE (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-IslandDeconvMode

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_SSDSOLVEPARS (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-SSDSolvePars

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_SSDCOSTFUNC (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-SSDCostFunc

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_BICFACTOR (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-BICFactor

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_ARTIFACTROBUST (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-ArtifactRobust

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_CONVFFTSWITCH (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-ConvFFTSwitch

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_NENLARGEPARS (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-NEnlargePars

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_NENLARGEDATA (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-NEnlargeData

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_RESTOREMETROSWITCH (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-RestoreMetroSwitch

parameters.info: SSDCLEAN_MINMAXGROUPDISTANCE (???)
parameters.name: SSDClean-MinMaxGroupDistance

parameters.info: GACLEAN_NSOURCEKIN (???)
parameters.name: GAClean-NSourceKin

parameters.info: GACLEAN_NMAXGEN (???)
parameters.name: GAClean-NMaxGen

parameters.info: log memory use
parameters.name: Log-Memory

parameters.info: able progress bars and other pretty console output
parameters.name: Log-Boring

parameters.info: append to log file if it exists (default truncates)
parameters.name: Log-Append

parameters.info: grid worker processes upon launch (with SIGSTOP). Useful to attach gdb to workers.
parameters.name: Debug-PauseWorkers

parameters.info: L,M Shift in facet coordinates in arcseconds for l and m (this phase steers the sky over the image plane).
parameters.name: Debug-FacetPhaseShift

parameters.info: Compute and print RMS in minor cycle iterations.
parameters.name: Debug-PrintMinorCycleRMS

parameters.info: Dump intermediate minor cycle solutions to a file. Use 0 or 1, or give an explicit list of things to dump
parameters.name: Debug-DumpCleanSolutions

parameters.info: X,Y,R Also dump postage stamps when cleaning within a radius R of X,Y. Implies --Debug-DumpCleanSolutions.
parameters.name: Debug-DumpCleanPostageStamps

parameters.info: Throw an exception when a fitted CLEAN component is below this threshold in flux. Useful for debugging.
parameters.name: Debug-CleanStallThreshold

parameters.info: Enable memory-greedy mode. Retain certain shared arrays in RAM as long as possible.
parameters.name: Debug-MemoryGreedy

parameters.info: Verbosity level for multiprocessing.
parameters.name: Debug-APPVerbose

parameters.info: N seed random number generator with explicit seed, if given. Useful for reproducibility of the random-based optimizations (sparsification, etc.).
parameters.name: Misc-RandomSeed

parameters.info: Noise image to compute sigma for stopping threshold (in case specified it will replace Deconv-FluxThreshold)
parameters.name: Noise-Image

parameters.info: Noise sigma for stopping deconvolution in the case where noise_image is provided (new thresh = sigma*noise_image.std())
parameters.name: Noise-Sigma
